data.title: BoundingBox calculated for animated Model is incorrect
data.body: `Model.calculateBoundingBox()` returns a bounding box with irrelevant size when used on the model that is found under https://github.com/chili-epfl/cellulo/tree/master/android/assets/models/funky_palm_tree/ whose Blender files is found under https://github.com/chili-epfl/cellulo/tree/master/android/assets/models/funky_palm_tree/_pre_production. This probably has something to do with the model being animated. The returned bounding box size is `3.0799556 3.9324253 3.8297634` while the actual model's non-animated mesh's (mesh on first frame) bounding box is of size `4.657 5.783 5.456`. The returned bounding box is also unchanging during animation of the `ModelInstance`.

data.title: BitmapFontCache WrappedText should map 1:1 to the original String
data.body:
I add several strings to a BitmapFontCache, with addWrappedText() and save the concatenation of the Strings.
At some point I want to color substrings inside the saved text, but this won't work because addWrappedText() trims the whitespaces from the line's ends.
This will mean that the index in the BitmapFontCache won't match with the index inside the saved String, leading to issues, or even crashes if the index by chance is out of bounds.

data.title: Fixed minor issue in AssetManagerTest
data.body:
The last night  I've wasted more than 2 hours trying to fix a non-existent bug in the new I18NBundleLoader.
I was pretty desperate so I sought the help of @Mobidevelop on irc and he spent no more than 5 minutes to figure it out. lol

```
<@mobidevelop> That test is funky
<@mobidevelop> the way that test is made, the last item loaded will never return true for isLoaded
<@mobidevelop> because once the last item is loaded, everything gets unloaded
<@mobidevelop> If you move your asset load to the beginning, it will return true for isLoaded
```

So I decided to fix that funky test waiting for a reasonable amount of time (0.2 seconds) before reloading the assets.
This should prevent other unfortunate people from encountering the same issue.

data.title: ModelBatch.renderablesPool should be accessible to enable ray picking of Modelnstance
data.body:
`ModelBatch.renderablesPool` should be accessible from the outside, i.e be "public" in a naive case, to provide access to the `Renderable`s that are part of `ModelInstance`s that are normally rendered to the screen. This way, the `Mesh`es inside the `Renderable`s can be used for ray picking via `Intersector.intersectRayTriangles()`. 

To my knowledge, the only way to ray pick a `ModelInstance` currently is to get its `Model`s `Mesh`, bone deform it, transform it and then ray pick it. This is a huge waste of resources.

data.title: Update Stage.java
data.body: Added a alpha, so one can fade the children of the stage. (Extending the Stage will work but is ugly. Might be handy to someone else as well.)

data.title: Allow iOS orientation changes when returning to libgdx game's ViewController
data.body:
Add override for getSupportedInterfaceOrientations() and shouldAutorotate() to IOSUIViewController in robovm backend to ensure that any time a user returns to the libgdx game, the rotation is set correctly based on the settigs in the libgdx config object.

Allow LandscapeLeft and LandscapeRight for "landscape" orientation. Allow Portrait and PortraitUpsideDown for "portrait" orientation. May want to consider removing the PortraitUpsideDown, depending on community preferences.

Reference my forum post: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=14211

data.title: Box2d: Fixed issue #1381. Missing fixtureB in Contact when Body is removed.
data.body:
Hi! I've got a simple solution to the bug #1381. :P
In the World class the destroyBody() method frees Java objects in the wrong order. All joints, fixtures and the body are removed before jniDestroyBody() method is called and usually this is a correct behaviour. But, in this case the ContactListener callbacks are invoked while destroying the body, so Java-side objects should be preserved until their native counterparts are destroyed.

data.title: ModelBuilder.createArrow() doesn't display correctly
Added I18NBundleLoader.
data.body:
It works, but I think we have a general problem with bundle loaders.
I mean, the 2 bundles below have the same base name but different locale

``` java
manager.load("data/i18n/message1", I18NBundle.class, new I18NBundleParameter(Locale.ITALIAN));
manager.load("data/i18n/message1", I18NBundle.class, new I18NBundleParameter(Locale.ENGLISH));
```

The second bundle won't be loaded.
How to fix this?
If the fix is too expensive we might just put an alert on the asset loader wiki page since this is not a common case.

data.title: Fix iOS Todos
data.body:
**General**
- [ ] see issue tracker, RoboVM specific issues are marked with [RoboVM]
- [ ] OGG is currently not supported by ObjectAL
- [x] Update: Vibration is not really supported on iOS. (Very Basic support added)

**IOSApplicationConfiguration**
- [ ] add compass

**IOSGraphics**
- [ ] need to store current device orientation for Input#getOrienation and consorts

**IOSInput** 
- [ ] getAzimuth(), getPitch(), getRoll(), getRotationMatrix() need to be implemented and output the same as android  **CoreMotion was misbehaving here, check issues resolved before re-implementing** 
- [ ] add compass support, fix up isPeripheralAvailable()

**IOSAudio**
- [ ] newAudioDevice(), new AudioRecorder() not implemented

**IOSSound**
- [x] add support for manipulating an already playing sound instance, seems to work through ALSource (see https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/c2f5bff128d7029aa87789ab7bde41c6af199d73)
- [x] add support for pitch shifting, not sure ObjectAL can do that (see https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/c2f5bff128d7029aa87789ab7bde41c6af199d73)

data.title: UTF8 characters become corrupted in desktop build
data.body:
I have non-latin (cyrillic) characters in my LibGDX-based project.

When I build it for html every character looks fine. But when I build it for desktop (via Intellij IDEA or using gradle command line) I get following error during build process:

```
...
18:02:12.193 [INFO] [org.gradle.api.internal.tasks.execution.SkipUpToDateTaskExecuter] Executing task ':core:compileJava' (up-to-date check took 0.066 secs) due to: ....
18:02:12.265 [INFO] [org.gradle.api.internal.tasks.compile.jdk6.Jdk6JavaCompiler] Compiling with JDK Java compiler API.
18:02:12.590 [ERROR] [system.err] FinalScore.java:71: error: unmappable character for encoding Cp1251
18:02:12.595 [ERROR] [system.err]         font.draw(batch, "╨?╨│╤А╨░ ╨╛╨║╨╛╨╜╤З╨╡╨╜╨░!", 70, 520);
18:02:12.597 [ERROR] [system.err]                            ^
...
```

After this error message build successfully finish but messages in my program look corrupted.

I fixed this for myself adding line into core\build.gradle:

```
[compileJava, compileTestJava]*.options*.encoding = 'UTF-8'
```

BTW I found this line in ios\build.gradle.

My environment:
Windows 7 x64
Russian locale
LibGDX version 1.0.1

data.title: gdx2d_load ignores format specified
data.body:
See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1812#issuecomment-42738390

For whatever reason, stb_image doesn't respect the requested format. Need to perform the format conversion manually. This only affects loading pixmaps from memory.

data.title: Added posibility to override density on desktop
data.body:
As suggested in issue #1823.

Example of usage: http://i.imgur.com/Xj2n3tG.png

This is very handy to emulate screen sizes on desktop, without having to use the android emulator. E.g. set the resolution to 800x480 and set overrideDensity to 252 to emulate a 3.7 inch phone display with the same resolution.

data.title: DPI override on desktop
Save and load extra content from atlas with Texture Packer / Unpacker
data.body:
Hi!
The current Texture Unpacker isn't saving some extra content when unpacking atlas file like splits/pads.
With this pr I added these information into external file that is read when repacking the imgs, only if no new splits/pads are defined.

Bye :)

data.title: Couldn't load shared library 'gdx-freetype64.dll' in latest nightlies
data.body:
I just updated my build.gradle files to reflect 1.0.2 changes by changing or adding these lines:

```
classpath 'com.android.tools.build:gradle:0.10+'
gdxVersion = '1.0.2-SNAPSHOT'
roboVMVersion = '0.0.12'
maven { url "https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/releases/" }
```

Now when I start the desktop app in windows 8.1 update 1 it returns an error:

```
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load shared library 'gdx-freetype64.dll' for target: Windows 8.1, 64-bit
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:115)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeType.initFreeType(FreeType.java:541)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeTypeFontGenerator.<init>(FreeTypeFontGenerator.java:102)
    at com.marclabsoftware.games.myapp.utilities.FontFactory.<init>(FontFactory.java:49)
    at com.marclabsoftware.games.myapp.utilities.Utilities.init(Utilities.java:96)
    at com.marclabsoftware.games.myapp.MyApp.create(MyApp.java:54)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:136)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:114)
Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Unable to read file for extraction: gdx-freetype64.dll
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.readFile(SharedLibraryLoader.java:124)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.loadFile(SharedLibraryLoader.java:245)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:113)
    ... 7 more
```

No problem in android with 1.0.2
In windows 8 If I go back to 1.0.1 it works good

data.title: Stage isn't checking if batch is already drawing
data.body:
The stage and many other classes (like OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer) doesn't check if their batch is already drawing. This makes it useless (if not custom shader) to feed your own batch into for example a stage. This is an example were stage could have checked if their batch was already drawing : http://pastebin.com/5LL82MxQ, and if the change was made, would look like this: http://pastebin.com/Kus1CVGm. This would lower the draw calls and not destroy already existing libgdx programs. 

True, the performance isn't really affected much because of this, but maybe just tiny tiny bit. The performance would only be better if (talking about the example) the sprite and stages textures came from the same textureatlas. 

The performance would get a tiny bit lowered because of the constant checking.

data.title: Added option to SharedLibraryFinder interface to specify extraction sub-...
data.body:
...folder for native libraries.

By default JniGenSharedLibraryLoader extracts each native library to its own temp folder (named by the crc32 of its content). With this small change the application can opt to specify a custom folder name.

I'm working with a setup of two dynamic libraries which depend on each other (libB links to libA), and by extracting them both to the same folder I can avoid the library path issue when libB is loaded.
